article_title: Maine's Three-Way Governor's Race Worries LePage Foes
article_text:
PORTLAND, Maine—Republican Gov. Paul LePage won his race in 2010 with 39% of the vote after an independent candidate fractured the left—an unusual scenario that is playing out again this election year in the blue-leaning state.

The three-way race has the same independent candidate in the mix, and the prospect of a repeat is delighting Mr. LePage's backers and churning up jitters among his detractors. The governor and Democratic Rep. Mike Michaud each have support of 38% of survey respondents, followed by independent...

twitter.description: A three-way race for Maine governor includes the same independent candidate who split the left-leaning vote in 2010, potentially helping Republican Paul LePage and worrying his opponents.
twitter.title: Maine's Three-Way Governor's Race Worries LePage Foes
